Midwest Roybal Center  Tobacconomics   News           ABOUT IHRP      “At IHRP, UIC researchers examine questions related to health, as defined in the broadest terms. The multiple areas that influence health comprise our work: health behaviors; social determinants of health, including social and economic factors; clinical care; the physical environment; and health-related practices and policies.  “Education, employment, income, family and social support, community safety — all are highly relevant to health outcomes. I invite UIC researchers studying any of these influences to join us.”  — ROBIN MERMELSTEIN, PhD, DIRECTOR         Presentations        Meta-Analysis and the Early Career Researcher     Methods for Investigating Heterogeneity in Intervention Effects: Beyond Traditional Tests of Moderation      more           Announcements        Notice of Filing - LCA      more      News        Cook County’s Short-Lived ‘Soda’ Tax Worked, Says New Study    A study of beverage sales in Cook County, Illinois, shows that for four months in 2017 — when the county implemented a penny-per-ounce tax on both sugar-sweetened and artificially sweetened drinks — purchases of the taxed beverages decreased by 21%, even after an adjustment for cross-border shopping.      IHRP Research Professional Receives Award of Merit    The Institute congratulates Sharon Feldman on receiving this University recognition for employees who demonstrate service, commitment and dedication in their careers.       more              Search            Events        11th Annual UIC Minority Health Conference (Virtual Event)    Fri, 04/24/2020 - 10:30am     ChicagoCHEC Seminar Series – NIH Biosketch Webinar (Virtual Event)    Wed, 05/27/2020 - 12:00pm      more      IHRP on Twitter   Tweets by @UICIHRP
